comment: Prof. Duvall is one of, if not the most, funny and down-to-earth professors I've ever had. His lectures are always enjoyable and, as emphasized in other reviews, he doesn't want you to fail! I got ~ a 50 test average and still got a C with all the free extra credit points available. Just make sure to do practice problems and you'll be fine!
Duvall is an excellent professor, I have taken courses with him many times and would recommend anyone take courses with him whenever possible.

Charles is a fantastic professor and a great guy. Lectures are basically him going over topics and working practice problems. Tons of industry experience and is willing to give students professional advice on top of the academics. The more you put into this class, the more you get out of it. Go talk to him if you're struggling, he knows his stuff.

Duvall is alright, I had some issues with him that left me with a lower grade. He's not accessible outside of class AT ALL. Don't bother emailing him expecting an answer back. HW was pretty easy (only 2). Quizzes are free 100, have to attend class tho, they're pop quizzes. Labs were easy, Project was a complete mess. 2 weeks not enough.

Duvall was alright, Unfortunately I had some issues with him that resulted in a lower grade. He NEVER answers his emails, so don't bother contacting him unless its after class or during office hours. Exams aren't bad, homework was easy, quizzes are a free 100. Labs were also pretty easy except the project. 2 weeks was not enough at all. Good luck!

Charles is a good guy!  He really loves his students and wants them to do well.  If you try and mess up, he will give you the utmost opportunity to make up for it with EC and make it in EE if he thinks you can do it.  Highly recommended

Duvall is a great professor for Emag. His lectures would be very similar to what was on the homeworks and tests. The projects are cool but annoying at the same time. Make sure to start on projects early and double check your homework/tests. Get ready to do more work towards the end of the semester.
He is hard to reach outside of class. He was very helpful with my grade, though. We talked about it during office hours, and I received an A in his class.
Took for Intro to Engineering, professors switch out, but Duvall is there for 2 weeks and is awesome.

Unfortunately could not finish 2501 with him for non-academic reasons, but for the time I took his class, he was truly an excellent professor. His lectures were very informative yet he doesn't spoonfeed. Wants students to succeed both academically and professionally. Lab was well organized with helpful and knowledgeable TAs. Best 2501 professor!
Professor Duvall is amazing, there is no other way around it.  I wish that I have him as a prof for all of my other EE courses!

Just go to every class. Quizzes are free A's if you attend class. Lab is annoying at the worst, but still doable for those that struggle with EE stuff like me cause I'm am a CE major. HE DOES NOT WANT YOU TO FAIL. Go to class and show a effort. I got a 68 and a 56 on our two tests and the final extra credit hit so hard that I have a B overall.

Duvall definitely doesn't spell everything out for you. He wants you to think and figure it out for yourself. If you read the book and do recommend problems, it will help you immensely. Not an easy course by any means, but if you show effort and try he will work with you.

Duvall is a great professor. Participation and attentiveness is imperative to your success in this class. As long as you take notes, do the recommended problems, and all assignments you will be fine on the tests. Tests are typically either take home or open notes and always resemble the homework and recommended problems.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Very clear when explaining projects and helpful in the lab. The class doesn't have many grades so make sure you show up at your lab time, but he is flexible.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Duvall is hilarious and will try to make the content enjoyable for students to learn. Gave our class 2 homeworks, 2 exams and 1 final (all take home). He will most likely always go out of his way to help you if you are struggling as long as you show up to class and show you care. He's a cool guy and easy to approach

EE2301: Tests were take home, and so understandably he graded harder on them (he warned us when we chose take-home over in-class). Very hilarious and also explained the content very well. I highly recommend.

I scraped by the entire semester and no matter how hard I worked, it was not enough. This professor is great for EE students...but not for CPE or any non-EE major. Puts himself out there as this amazing professor, but he's only an amazing professor if you get 100s on everything he gives you.

No structure whatsoever! In April, we only had one exam done then the last week of this semester he assigns one exam and final. Goes off topic in lectures and starts ranting about insignificant things. His exams are take home, but he is not a great lecturer and asks insane questions with tons of pages of work. Good luck getting grades back.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Prof Duvall is very lighthearted and cracks lots of jokes in class. His lectures weren't a very rigid structure, which i personally liked however to some may be confusing if you like order. Extremely insightful about workforce/internships and gives good advice. Overall loved his class and 100% recommend for digital logic.

Very approachable, laid back, and funny. Gives harder take home exams that take a lot of the anxiety out of the course and really encourages the students to reach out and ask questions about real world connections to the material. Loose structure to the lectures, which breaks up the monotony, but also sometimes makes the material harder to follow.

One of my favorite professors I have had so far. Even though I am a mechanical engineering major, he made electrical easy to understand and also relevant to our field. I would definitely take him again if I had the chance.

Professor Duvall is amazing. This EMag class was pretty much all online but he made the best of it. He helped us out very much and cared about trying to teaching us the subject. Very personable and easy to talk to. 10/10 will take again.

I find Professor Duvall is arguably my favorite professor so far at KSU. I'm currently taking him for two different classes this semester, and took him for Digital Logic over the Summer semester. He is very engaged, and actually makes lecture interesting enough to attend. If you can take him for any EE or ENGR course, do it, you will do fine 100%.
the best teacher in kSU

This class was so easy. I hate the feeling that everyone can do well with minimal effort and that is what Charles did. No tests, just very easy projects with literal step-by-step instructions to complete them. Multitude of bonus points for people who "happen to forget an assignment". like wat? YOU GET AN A, YOU GET AN A.. This man wants no trouble.

He is an amazingly caring professor that will go above and beyond to help his students. His tests were not easy, and no matter how hard I studied, I never did as well on them as I though I should. He offered a very generous extra credit assignment at the end of the semester that helped a lot of people out. He is a true gem.
Probably the nicest and most outgoing professors I have had. He is very laidback and will give help where is needed. You will enjoy this professor if you take him. 10/10 would recommend.
Laidback just do your work and your fine

HE is a tough grader but all work including test are take home. He was amazing. Im a new EE major and he would take the time to go through old material to make sure i was up to speed. he is a amazing teacher i definitely recommend him. He loves his job so much if you see him about another class he is still willing to help.

Duvall is very knowledgeable on the things he is teaching and is very good at conveying the message. With that being said paying attention in class and practicing the problems on your own is a very big part of this class in general, he is willing to answer any questions you have. The tests are like the graded homework he gives but changed variables

Great guy in class and out of class. He's relaxed and enjoys talking about lots of things. He wants to help you and he wants to see you succeed. Was in the 1st semester of EE2305 and he made it easy for a ME to learn EE stuff.

Dr. Duvall is one of the best professors I have had in my college experience. He teaches the material by example. By working out different problems, and show how its done, and explain why it's done like that. He treats tests like industry which means use any material that will help you besides internet and a friend, aka open note and book tests.

Professor Duvall is one of the most laid back professors I've had. I had him for lab and was really cool about all our assignments. He will make you feel dumb sometimes if you ask a dumb question. The few times he actually lectured he explained stuff really well.

I took Prof. Duvall for EE1000 and based on my good experience, took him for EE2301. The content itself is challenging but Duvall really cares about you effectively learning the material. He has helped me countless times and I think that really helped me get an A in the class. But be prepared to study because it's an absolute must!
down to earth. great guy. will work with you. I liked his lectures. gives you a chance to invest in the class

Professor Duvall is amazing. Hes hilarious and very down to earth. Hes very understanding of students because he understands we have a life and other classes besides his. Class is helpful to attend since he does plenty of example problems. Had 3 super easy online quizzes and 4 exams and 4 graded hws, all very fair. Do your part and youll get A.
Professor Duvall is the absolute best!

His homework was far and few apart and it was easy to do. Labs are very easy, pretty much show up and you get an A for that portion. Grade was final project heavy but you get to create your own project that fits in the criteria but overall not bad. He is super nice and easy to understand and is willing to go the extra step to make sure you get it.
A great professor.  Cares about his students and will gladly help you with an problems you might encounter during the course.

Excellent professor! Would gladly take again for future classes. He has a few online assignments, journal entries, and a few labs to give you a feel for future classes. There may be a few job site field trips. He is accessible outside of class. The more you participate, the more he'll appreciate you.

Great man with a lot of history. Teaches for fun, not for salary. Will help you along with finding your future career EE or not. Show up to class, listen to him speak, easy A. Sometimes there are online assignments. Don't miss those. Also there are some labs which are fun. SHOW UP EARLY!!! Cannot stress that enough for the lab days.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I had Professor Duvall for Intro to EE. It one of the the easiest classes I've taken at KSU - you basically show up and pass. The actual lectures can be fairly dull and you have to write a short journal entry for each class, but he has you do practical things like solder a power supply and write a practice lab report, so I'd recommend him.

Duvall is great. He just spends his lecture time doing circuit problems and introduces new concepts as he goes along. You can even talk to him for help on circuits in later classes. If you write down all the problems he does in class and do all the homework, then you've got a free A and a great grasp of the circuits theory as well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is a nice guy, but for those not familiar with circuit. you will be left not understanding anything. I don't agree with his teaching method, because he doesn't really explaining anything. He just works on problems without explanation. It feels like you're playing a game without knowing the rules of what you can and can't do in circuit.

The second worst professor I've had thus far.  Not to say that he's not a nice guy but his method of teaching is deplorable.  He assigns ungraded hw, then gives you graded hw that has nothing to do with what you just learned.  Then he'll give you a test based off of the graded hw and changes the problems.  Avoid taking him for this course!!

Duvall is EASILY the best professor in EE. It really sucks that he is only part time. He understands that non EE students have to take the course and breaks things down for them too. I'm a year out of this class and Duvall is STILL my go to guy for help. He has a very clear understanding of a lot of things and can make any material easy to digest.

Duvall said that everyone who takes his class gets an A, it's just "The flavor of your A" that will change. This wasn't always the case, however. I did well on the tests but had to study a lot for them in order to pass with an A. Online HW is tough and tricky but usually someone in the class knows how to do it. He offers a ton of help luckily. Like

Allright Professor. Does not derive the equations and formulas enough though. Also works some problems halfway, and does complete the question. He also does not like a lot of questions in class. He cares about how students do in his class though. He also has a good personality and is funny.

This professor is awesome. I took him Fall of 2013. He might not work problems all the way. Just do the homework problems over and over and you'll learn while doing well on the tests. Labs suck though...
Good professor, gave extra credit.  pretty good lab instructor, approachable fair with partial credit
Prof Duvall is a very simple guy. He doesn't ask much of his students. just do the assigned homeworks and attend class, and you will surely pass his class.
It's like we are all learning the subject as we go, including him. Explanations unclear and confusing, works a lot of problems halfway, and never really puts forth an effort.

His explanations are terribly unclear and make the material more difficult. Tests involve special cases that you didn't learn in class. He does a lot of examples, but never works them all the way through, leaving confusing gaps in key concepts. I'd recommend taking someone else for Circuits 1.

Very helpful guy. Caring and understanding. Will explain the same concept as many times as you need. The material may be confusing, but he will try his best to help you. Do what your are asked, go to class, and you'll learn something!
He has a good personality but the way he teaches is horrible in my opinion.

I've had Duvall twice now. great prof! likes teaching by using real world examples which is very helpful. all his tests come directly from the labs. Tests are generally open note/book. Take his class, doesn't matter what class it is!

Excellent professor. Duvall is a excellent professor his test are tricky but if you put effort into his class he will notice trust me. Also, he gives extra credit to help you pass his class. I couldn't ask for a better professor TAKE HIM if you want someone who would give you a chance to pass even if you score low on the exams.

GREAT TEACHER. Really cares about you understanding the material and has lots of realworld examples. Fair tests. ECET isnt easy so expect to always study but he'll work w your sched to meet w you if you need help. Doesnt play favorites like the comment below- if you put effort in the class- he'll notice; likewise, if you don't- don't expect a curve
Duvall is the best professor I've had so far in the ECET dept.  He's a great guy and has a great command of the subject matter.  Completely fair on grading, highly recommended!!  :)
Pretty dull subject matter, so the lectures did seem to drag on at times, but Duvall made them as interesting as he could... Nice guy, relatively easy tests :)
Duvall, i have had him for 1200,3220, and 3600. More than fair to me in all of those classes. No tricks on the test or his grading. I would take him for any class he teaches.

Cool teacher! Teaches everything  based on real world applications. He has got a lot of interesting/inspiring stories to tell.  Very nice guy. Class-wise, be prepared to do a lot of studying/learning on your  own. Nevertheless, I would recommend him.

once again grade based upon whether he likes you or not, Does not grade based upon syllabus at all or your actual performance in class. Could be beneficial could be detrimental. Come to lab always help.
Yes, his lecture is kind of boring, but he is willing to help you if you have any question. Great professor, take him if you could.
No Comments
No Comments

I really like Professor Duvall, but in this class he was completely out of it. His test were off the wall. He did a poor job of assigning homework to compliment lectures. He spent most of the lecture time telling us how to do the lab, and how dangerous we would soon be with this kind of knowledge.
No Comments
Very helpful and decently easy.  Tests are easy and predictable. Labs expect you to make medium to large deductions on your own, but he will give you hints until you get it.

Straighforward and competent teacher.  Good sense of humor.  Very personable.  Tests of presented material and very willing to help.  Has a very direct approach to material covered and tests are fair, but not easy.
No Comments
Excellent professor.  Great teacher.  Highly, highly recommended.
Great teacher.  He expects you to know what you are doing in the labs. Wants you to be a very independent  learner. EASY tests.  EASY homework.  Listen to him becauuse he talks very low in class.
